page.title: 16LEVERTON FIRE STATION
page.content: Leverton fire station was built in Leverton because no_one in other villages would run it.The crew is made up of 10 men. There should be 12 firemen altogether.The fire station is 57 years old.The tower is for drying the hoses.The old hoses are canvas but the new hoses are duralone.The siren in the tower is used as a flood warning now.When they are called out they have an alert to let them know. They all like the job and are not scared.The names of the crew are:ROGER,RAY,JOHN,MELVIN,ALAN,ROBIN, IVOR,HAROLD and PETER.They practice at Sauls farm and Boston.They clean the fire engine after being out on call.They all like the job because it's worthwhile.All the calls go to Lincoln.
